testimonials: Lobster Jo’s was wonderful. My 11 year old learned new skills, made friends and was never bored. Came home each day had a snack and a nap, which never happens. She loved it!!
Please continue this program the rest of the summer and bring it back next summer. The camp is incredibly well run, the counselors are excellent and my daughter has loved her time there.

page_title: UCSB Summer Day Camp | Department of Recreation

rows:
"We are thankful for this full-day camp as full-time working parents, the energy of the counselors, the safe environment, variety of activities and access to UCSB campus and resources. The staff are very helpful, hard-working and do a great job getting to know the campers and families! We appreciate this program very much and will continue to participate for several
			more years to come!"

"My kids have always loved this camp! They love the variety of activities and the chance to swim and jump off the high dive. The weekly themes are great and the carnival is always a big hit. Also, the camp counselors are great with the kids. The hours of the camp are fantastic as well and are super parent-friendly!"

Camp Olympics
			On your marks, get set, GO! This week, campers will show off their Olympic skills as they learn about different ways of getting active and having fun. Be prepared to run, skip, and leap as we explore different sports.
			Friday Dress Up: Rock your Sportswear!

Superheroes
			My Spidey Senses are tingling! This week campers will embody their favorite superheroes while participating in games and crafts! 
			Friday Dress Up: Dress as your favorite Superhero!

Party in the USA
			Happy Fourth Of July! This week we will join together in to celebrate Independence Day with crafts, games, and more. 
			Friday Dress Up: Red, White, & Blue / Stars!

The Great Outdoors
			"Camper" takes on a whole new meaning this week. Campers will get to explore the great outdoors and see all of the exciting surprises that nature has to offer. Gauchos (ages 11-14) will head over to the Sci Trek laboratory on campus to participate in nature-based science experiments.

Carnival
			Carnival week is one of our favorites and is jam packed with exciting activities. Join us for the fun this week where we bring out our Rock Wall, Bounce Houses, Carnival games and so much more!

Magical World of Camp
			This week, campers will be surrounded by the magic of the Happiest Place on Earth! They will enjoy themed games and crafts about all of their favorite characters. The Gauchos Group will learn about the magic of science at the Sci Trek Lab on campus! 
			Friday Dress Up: Disney Merch!

Young Einsteins 
			Get ready to challenge those brains! This week our campers will dust off their lab coats as they explore the wonders of science and put their imaginations and creations to the test this week with some exciting science experiments! The Gauchos will work in a real-life college lab with our campus partners, Sci Trek! 
			Friday Dress Up: Favorite Science or Scientist!

Camps Got Talent
			For this week, our campers will show off their creative skills and talent as they paint, craft, and create. Campers will end their week with a talent show, with the option to either participate or watch, so be sure to start preparing your act now!

Summer Send Off!
			Campers will end their summer the right way with games, crafts, and an epic music festival. Campers will dance, play, run, and jump their way back into school!
*Session 1 and 3 are prorated as follows due to the Juneteenth and Independence Day holidays (No camp on June 19 or July 4)

Payments must be received by the above dates to qualify for promotional price. Postmarks will NOT be accepted. Price increases take effect online at midnight on dates indicated. In person payments must be made by 5pm on dates indicated.

Also, the camp counselors are great with the kids. The hours of the camp are fantastic as well and are super parent-friendly!"

Camp Olympics
On your marks, get set, GO! This week, campers will show off their Olympic skills as they learn about different ways of getting active and having fun. Be prepared to run, skip, and leap as we explore different sports.
Friday Dress Up: Rock your Sportswear!

Superheroes
My Spidey Senses are tingling! This week campers will embody their favorite superheroes while participating in games and crafts! 
Friday Dress Up: Dress as your favorite Superhero!

Party in the USA
Happy Fourth Of July! This week we will join together in to celebrate Independence Day with crafts, games, and more. 
Friday Dress Up: Red, White, & Blue / Stars!

The Great Outdoors
"Camper" takes on a whole new meaning this week. Campers will get to explore the great outdoors and see all of the exciting surprises that nature has to offer. Gauchos (ages 11-14) will head over to the Sci Trek laboratory on campus to participate in nature-based science experiments.

Carnival
Carnival week is one of our favorites and is jam packed with exciting activities. Join us for the fun this week where we bring out our Rock Wall, Bounce Houses, Carnival games and so much more!

Magical World of Camp
This week, campers will be surrounded by the magic of the Happiest Place on Earth! They will enjoy themed games and crafts about all of their favorite characters. The Gauchos Group will learn about the magic of science at the Sci Trek Lab on campus! 
Friday Dress Up: Disney Merch!

Young Einsteins 
Get ready to challenge those brains! This week our campers will dust off their lab coats as they explore the wonders of science and put their imaginations and creations to the test this week with some exciting science experiments! The Gauchos will work in a real-life college lab with our campus partners, Sci Trek! 
Friday Dress Up: Favorite Science or Scientist!

Camps Got Talent
For this week, our campers will show off their creative skills and talent as they paint, craft, and create. Campers will end their week with a talent show, with the option to either participate or watch, so be sure to start preparing your act now!

Summer Send Off!
Campers will end their summer the right way with games, crafts, and an epic music festival. Campers will dance, play, run, and jump their way back into school!
*Session 1 and 3 are prorated as follows due to the Juneteenth and Independence Day holidays (No camp on June 19 or July 4)

Payments must be received by the above dates to qualify for promotional price. Postmarks will NOT be accepted. Price increases take effect online at midnight on dates indicated. In person payments must be made by 5pm on dates indicated.

Bible Missionary Institute founded and it met in First Fundamental Church in Los Angeles on Alvardo Street.
Bible Missionary Institute was renamed Western Bible College.
Western Bible College moved to Westmoreland Street, Los Angeles.
Western Bible College was renamed Westmont College.
Westmont purchased and relocated to a portion of the current property of the campus, El Tejada (the Murphy Estate) in Montecito from Charles and Eva Holland.
Coyote Fire. Student housing, Catherwood Hall, burned down in the fire
Bible Missionary Institute founded and it met in First Fundamental Church in Los Angeles on Alvardo Street.
Bible Missionary Institute was renamed Western Bible College.
Western Bible College moved to Westmoreland Street, Los Angeles.
Western Bible College was renamed Westmont College.
Westmont purchased and relocated to a portion of the current property of the campus, El Tejada (the Murphy Estate) in Montecito from Charles and Eva Holland.
Post Office (Operation Elbow Room) was built.
Carroll Observatory and Ruth Gapen Hubbard Hall were built.
Dining Commons (original) and John C. Page Residence hall were built.
Ellen Porter Hall of Fine Arts and the Nancy Voskuyl Prayer Chapel were built.
Van Kampen Residence hall was built.
Coyote Fire. Student housing, Catherwood Hall, burned down in the fire.
Roger John Voskuyl Library was built.
Hugh R. Murchinson Physical Education Complex was built.
The President’s house was built on the site of former student housing, Catherwood Hall. Armington Residence Halls (phase 1) was built. Kerrwood Fire in the President’s office.
Ruth Kerr Student Center was built.
Emerson Residence Hall III was built.
Thorrington Field and the Westmont Track was built.
Adams Center for the Visual Arts and the Westmont Art Museum was built.
Winter Hall for Science and Mathematics was built.
Completion of the Global Leadership Center in August

metaData.description: ATHLETICSWestmont Summer CampsFor almost 35 years Westmont has offered day camps for kids who want to develop in a sport in a safe and fun environment. We had a large increase in enrollment last year and we look forward to continuing this upward trajectory in the future. We are proud to have an excellent reputation in the community. Kids of all ages and skill levels will get to work with some of our coaches and student-athletes.

notes: Includes t-shirt. For children entering kindergarten (5 by 9/1). Safety focused.

extracted.program_structure: 6 one-week sessions at 3 locations (Goleta to Montecito)
